actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment

official_title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide medium-sized cities two additional years for submitting applications for stormwater permits and to extend the date for issuance of stormwater permits to medium-sized cities correspondingly.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to extend: (1) to May 17, 1995, the deadline by which permit applications for discharges from municipal storm sewers serving populations of between 100,000 and 250,000 must be filed; and (2) to May 17, 1996, the deadline by which such permits shall be issued or denied by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency or a State.

titles.title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide medium-sized cities two additional years for submitting applications for stormwater permits and to extend the date for issuance of stormwater permits to medium-sized cities correspondingly.
